actions.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Finance.

official_title: A bill to amend title XXI of the Social Security Act to make a technical correction with respect to the definition of qualifying State.
subjects: Federal aid to child health services

summary.text: Amends title XXI (State Children's Health Insurance) (SCHIP) of the Social Security Act (SSA) to make a technical amendment to the definition of qualifying State used for purposes of giving certain States operating under waivers of specified State plan requirements the authority to use up to 20 percent of their FY 1998 through 2001 SCHIP allotments, for fiscal years in which they are available, for paying the costs of covering under Medicaid (SSA title XIX) certain low-income children whose family income meets an income eligibility standard under such waivers of at least 185 percent of the poverty line. Requires that the income eligibility standard of at least 185 percent of the poverty line be determined by rounding to the nearest whole percentage.

titles.title: A bill to amend title XXI of the Social Security Act to make a technical correction with respect to the definition of qualifying State.
